member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps
member.summary: Information on raster-drawing capabilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsAnisotropy
member.summary: Device supports anisotropic filtering.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsColorPerspective
member.summary: Device iterates colors perspective correctly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsDepthBias
member.summary: Device supports legacy depth bias.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsDither
member.summary: Device can dither to improve color resolution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsFogRange
member.summary: Device supports range-based fog. In range-based fog, the distance of an object from the viewer is used to compute fog effects, not the depth of the object (that is, the z-coordinate) in the scene.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsFogTable
member.summary: Device calculates the fog value by referring to a lookup table containing fog values that are indexed to the depth of a given pixel.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsFogVertex
member.summary: Device calculates the fog value during the lighting operation and interpolates the fog value during rasterization.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsMipMapLevelOfDetailBias
member.summary: Device supports level of detail (LOD) bias adjustments. These bias adjustments enable an application to make a mipmap appear crisper or less sharp than it normally would.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsMultisampleToggle
member.summary: Device supports toggling multisampling on and off between Device.BeginScene and Device.EndScene.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsScissorTest
member.summary: Device supports scissor test.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsSlopeScaleDepthBias
member.summary: Device performs true slope-scale based depth bias.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsWBuffer
member.summary: Device supports depth buffering using w.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsWFog
member.summary: Device supports w-based fog. W-based fog is used when a perspective projection matrix is specified, but affine projections still use z-based fog. The system considers a projection matrix that contains a nonzero value in the [3][4] element to be a perspective projection matrix.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsZBufferLessHsr
member.summary: Device can perform hidden-surface removal (HSR) without requiring the application to sort polygons and without requiring the allocation of a depth-buffer. This leaves more video memory for textures. The method used to perform HSR is hardware-dependent and is transparent to the application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsZBufferTest
member.summary: Device can perform z-test operations. This effectively renders a primitive and indicates whether any z pixels have been rendered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterCaps.SupportsZFog
member.summary: Device supports z-based fog.

member.summary: TRUE if the raster is in the vertical blank period. FALSE if the raster is not in the vertical blank period.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.RasterStatus.ScanLine
member.summary: If InVBlank is FALSE, then this value is an integer roughly corresponding to the current scan line painted by the raster. Scan lines are numbered in the same way as Microsoft Direct3D surface coordinates: 0 is the top of the primary surface, extending to the value (height of the surface - 1) at the bottom of the display.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps
member.summary: Shading operations capabilities. It is assumed, in general, that if a device supports a given command at all, it supports the Flat mode. This flag specifies whether the driver can also support Gouraud shading and whether alpha color components are supported. When alpha components are not supported, the alpha value of colors generated is implicitly 255. This is the maximum possible alpha (that is, the alpha component is at full intensity).

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps.SupportsAlphaGouraudBlend
member.summary: Device can support an alpha component for Gouraud-blended transparency. In this mode, the alpha color component of a primitive is provided at vertices and interpolated across a face along with the other color components.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps.SupportsColorGouraudRgb
member.summary: Device can support colored Gouraud shading in the RGB color model. In this mode, the color component for a primitive is provided at vertices and interpolated across a face along with the other color components. In the RGB lighting model, the red, green, and blue components are interpolated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps.SupportsFogGouraud
member.summary: Device can support fog in the Gouraud shading mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShadeCaps.SupportsSpecularGouraudRgb
member.summary: Device supports Gouraud shading of specular highlights.

member.summary: Increment the stencil-buffer entry, wrapping to zero if the new value exceeds the maximum value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsIncrementSaturation
member.summary: Increment the stencil-buffer entry, clamping to the maximum value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsInvert
member.summary: Invert the bits in the stencil-buffer entry.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsKeep
member.summary: Do not update the entry in the stencil buffer. This is the default value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsReplace
member.summary: Replace the stencil-buffer entry with reference value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsTwoSided
member.summary: The device supports two-sided stencil.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.StencilCaps.SupportsZero
member.summary: Set the stencil-buffer entry to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SurfaceDescription.MultiSampleQuality
member.summary: Quality level. The valid range is between zero and one less than the level returned by pQualityLevels used by 9Checkdevicemultisampletype. Passing a larger value returns the error, D3DERR_INVALIDCALL. The MultisampleQuality values of paired render targets, depth stencil surfaces and the MultiSample type in Microsoft DirectX 8.0 must all match.

member.summary: Member of the D3dmultisampleType enumerated type, specifying the levels of full-scene multisampling supported by the surface.

member.summary: Member of the D3dpool enumerated type, specifying the class of memory allocated for this surface.

member.summary: Member of the D3dresourcetype enumerated type, identifying this resource as a surface.

member.summary: Width of the surface, in pixels.

member.summary: Device can draw alpha from texture palettes.

member.summary: Supports cube textures.

member.summary: Device requires that cube texture maps have dimensions specified as powers of two.

member.summary: Device supports mipmapped cube textures.

member.summary: Device supports mipmapped textures.

member.summary: Device supports mipmapped volume textures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsNonPower2Conditional
member.summary: Conditionally supports the use of 2-D textures with dimensions that are not powers of two.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsNoProjectedBumpEnvironment
member.summary: Device does not support a projected bump-environment loopkup operation in programmable and fixed function shaders.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsPerspective
member.summary: Perspective correction texturing is supported.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsPower2
member.summary: All textures must have widths and heights specified as powers of two. This requirement does not apply to either cube textures or volume textures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsProjected
member.summary: Supports the Projected texture transformation flag. When applied, the device divides transformed texture coordinates by the last texture coordinate. If this capability is present, then the projective divide occurs per pixel. If this capability is not present, but the projective divide needs to occur anyway, then it is performed on a per-vertex basis by the Direct3D runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsSquareOnly
member.summary: All textures must be square.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsTextureRepeatNotScaledBySize
member.summary: Texture indices are not scaled by the texture size prior to interpolation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsVolumeMap
member.summary: Device supports volume textures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureCaps.SupportsVolumeMapPower2
member.summary: Device requires that volume texture maps have dimensions specified as powers of two.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexFormatCaps
member.summary: Flexible vertex format capabilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexFormatCaps.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexFormatCaps.SupportsDoNotStripElements
member.summary: It is preferable that vertex elements not be stripped. That is, if the vertex format contains elements that are not used with the current render states, there is no need to regenerate the vertices. If this capability flag is not present, stripping extraneous elements from the vertex format provides better performance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexFormatCaps.SupportsPointSize
member.summary: Point size is determined by either the render state or the vertex data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexFormatCaps.SupportsTextureCoordinateCountMask
member.summary: Masks the low Int16 of VertexFormatCaps. These bits, cast to the Int16 data type, describe the total number of texture coordinate sets that the device can simultaneously use for multiple texture blending. (You can use up to eight texture coordinate sets for any vertex, but the device can blend using only the specified number of texture coordinate sets.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps
member.summary: Vertex processing capabilities. For a given physical device, this capability might vary across Device objects depending on the parameters supplied to device constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsDirectionAllLights
member.summary: Device can do directional lights.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsLocalViewer
member.summary: Device can do local viewer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsMaterialSource
member.summary: Device can do Microsoft DirectX 7.0 colormaterialsource operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsNoTextureGenerationNonLocalViewer
member.summary: Device does not support texture generation in non-local viewer mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsPositionAllLights
member.summary: Device can do positional lights (includes point and spot).

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsTextureGeneration
member.summary: Device can do texgen.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsTextureGenerationSphereMap
member.summary: Device supports texture generation for sphere maps.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexProcessingCaps.SupportsTweening
member.summary: Device can do vertex tweening.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps
member.summary: Vertex shader capabilities.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps.DynamicFlowControlDepth
member.summary: If this value is zero, then the device does not support dynamic flow control. If it is non zero, it supports dynamic flow control (instructions if, break and breakc). The value is equal to the depth of ifc-block nesting. The acceptable range of values for this is 0 to 24.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps.NumberTemps
member.summary: The number of temporary registers supported by the device. The acceptable range for this is 12 to 32.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps.StaticFlowControlDepth
member.summary: When this value is zero, then the device does not support static flow control. The value is equal to the depth of loop/call nesting. The acceptable range is 0 to 4.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VertexShaderCaps.SupportsPredication
member.summary: If true then instruction predication as defined in the predication section is supported.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport
member.summary: Defines the window dimensions of a render target surface onto which a 3-D volume projects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.ToString
member.summary: Obtains the String representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.Height
member.summary: Height dimension of the viewport on the render target surface, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this member should be set to the height dimension of the render target surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.MaxZ
member.summary: Value describing, together with MinZ, the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 1.0. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.MinZ
member.summary: Value describing, together with MaxZ, the range of depth values into which a scene is to be rendered, the minimum and maximum values of the clip volume. Most applications set this value to 0.0. Clipping is performed after applying the projection matrix.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.Width
member.summary: Width dimension of the viewport on the render target surface, in pixels. Unless you are rendering only to a subset of the surface, this member should be set to the width dimension of the render target surface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.X
member.summary: Pixel coordinate of the upper-left corner of the viewport on the render target surface. Unless you want to render to a subset of the surface, this member can be set to 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Viewport.Y
member.summary: Pixel coordinate of the upper-left corner of the viewport on the render target surface. Unless you want to render to a subset of the surface, this member can be set to 0.
